file_content.text: I envy you, taking up arms against this Jedi Master. It must be nice to take action for a change.
We've missed something. Our spies report that Master Keln has already left Voss-Ka. He's headed into the Ruined City.
What is the Empire involved in there?
What's in the Ruined City?
Nothing at all. That is what worries me.
I took care of everything you told me about.
I didn't miss anything.
Your work has been flawless. The Intelligence operatives responsible for monitoring Master Keln have been executed for this failure.
What does that even mean?
Your confusion is understandable. I, myself, don't understand what this means.
The ruins were a city that the Voss abandoned in antiquity. We have archaeologists there, but nothing compromising.
Nothing in that city should harm us, and yet that is where Master Keln has gone to retrieve his evidence.
If the Jedi went to this Ruined City, I'm going after him.
Then that's where I'm going.
Eliminate Master Keln and his evidence, and the Empire will be most grateful.
This may be a trap--or it's a distraction from wherever his real evidence is hidden.
This must be a ruse.
We must be sure there's nothing in those ruins. This Jedi will not cost us an alliance now.
How do I stop him?
The Empire requires you to go to the ruins, find Master Keln and eliminate him and whatever evidence he has.
I will craft a suitable excuse for his absence to the Voss.
Good luck.
Tell Darth Serevin that Durik Vesh is no longer a problem, General.
Excellent, my lord. Your timing is perfect; we've heard that Jedi Master Keln has just landed in Voss-Ka.
The target's been eliminated.
You completed that mission just in time. Intelligence reports that Jedi Master Keln has arrived in Voss-Ka.
Durik Vesh has been handled, General.
Perfect. Darth Serevin will be pleased. We've received word that Jedi Master Keln just landed in Voss-Ka.
You can report the good news to Darth Serevin. He asked to speak with you as soon as you returned.
This is a great opportunity. We've wanted to eliminate Vesh for weeks. You should be proud to be chosen.
I am extremely pleased. The gullible Voss already talk of the heroic outsider who held back the Gormak abominations.
However, we've little time to savor this victory. An opportunity has presented itself.
I've had my fill of fighting surveillance equipment, beasts and thugs.
Not more cleanup, I hope.
Tell me what needs to be done.
What sort of opportunity?
That sounds interesting.
There is a place the locals call the "Nightmare Lands." It is an area steeped in the power of the dark side.
A promising Sith named Durik Vesh led a group there to search for the source of the power.
But Vesh was weaker than we thought. Dark energy overpowered his mind. He went mad and was captured by the Republic.
What good is a madman to the Republic?
Why do they want him?
They are almost certainly trying to pick his addled brains for information: about us and the Nightmare Lands.
They'll use him against us.
Indeed. He's been kept out of sight. Locked in SIS maximum security. Until now.
Just tell me who you want killed.
Skip the explanations.
Direct. I like that.
Reports say Vesh is being moved. Under guard, naturally, but out in the open. We need him dead.
Seems highly convenient that the Republic is moving him now, just as we're trying to eliminate everything they have on us.
This sounds like a trap.
I would not trust this task to anyone less skilled than yourself. A failure here could cost the Empire Voss.
Why not just free him, or bring him back here?
Why do you want him dead?
We have too much at stake on this planet to coddle an insane fool who could not handle power.
Of course, my lord.
Vesh and his escort will be leaving the SIS camp shortly. They will pass through a canyon nearby. Intercept them and leave no witnesses.
Plant this in the canyon before the convoy arrives. I wish you luck.
You've all done extraordinary work. Our people had trouble spotting the towers' destruction, and they were watching for it.
My lord, thank you for your aid. Our scouts reported the towers' destruction, and the Voss seem none the wiser.
You do good work, hunter. The scouts watching your progress out there were positively gushing.
I should have known Intelligence would make quick work of the towers. Well done!
Our own scouts barely spotted the destruction of those towers in all the confusion out there. Well played.
The Republic must be squirming right now, wishing they could strike back at us.
The Voss told me you wanted to speak with me.
Why did you send for me?
I'd relish the chance to engage the Republic directly.
Let them try.
You're not alone. I'd much prefer to end all this skulking about.
I'd hate to be out of a job so soon.
Suits me just fine.
Very little danger of that. The Voss seem to delight in drawing out these negotiations.
Why can't they just go to the Voss and accuse us of destroying their property?
What's stopping them?
The Voss would investigate, discover the Republic had built spy towers near Voss-Ka, and you can imagine how they would react.
I assume we're not done yet.
We have more work to do before the arrival of this Jedi Master.
Wait. We have an incoming transmission.
If all goes well, you can destroy those Republic listening towers and earn us the gratitude of the Voss in a single blow.
Now, perhaps, we can strike at the Republic. Albeit indirectly. Cursed diplomats and their games....
You disagree with Darth Serevin's strategy?
You don't sound happy.
I would simply prefer a more direct approach.
I thought we couldn't do anything that would upset the Voss.
We can't be caught.
Every step is mired in politics. My only consolation is that the Republic is equally stymied.
You have my attention.
We've detected Republic spy towers in our vicinity. If I sent men to destroy them, we would incur suspicion from the Voss.
The Voss post nearby, however, appears to have come under attack. We can aid them and destroy the towers at the same time.
What enemy am I supposed to help them fight?
Who is attacking the Voss?
My scouts can't determine who or what the attackers are.
Two birds with one stone.
The Republic won't take the loss of their listening towers lightly.
The Republic will retaliate.
If this goads them to strike back at us openly, so much the better.
The commander of the Voss post is Panthin-Dro. Seek him out, give him the Empire's full support.
Welcome to Fort Kodentha. I'd only just received word you were coming.
My lord, Fort Kodentha is honored by your presence. Darth Serevin mentioned you were coming.
I am General Rosh. You must be the bounty hunter. Darth Serevin spoke highly of you.
Yes, you must be the agent Darth Serevin told me to expect. Welcome to Fort Kodentha.
Welcome to Fort Kodentha. I've been expecting this visit. Darth Serevin spoke very highly of you.
I heard what you did to the Houks. I must admit, I've wanted to exterminate those thugs for some time.
I'm busy at the moment. Another time.
